narrative.narrative: Arkia Israeli Airlines is the second largest airline of Israel, and has been around since 1949. Its main base is Sde Dov airport which is Tel Aviv's second airport which handles domestic flights. It has hubs at Eilat Airport and Ovda Airport, which are both in Eilat. It also has a base at the main Israel airport Ben Gurion in Tel Aviv too. They have 13 regular destinations including the bases, and 8 seasonal ones. Some of the cities served all year outside Israel are Paris,Larnaca in Cyprus,Munich in Germany,Rome in Italy,Amman in Jordan,Amsterdam in the Netherlands, and Barcelona in Spain. Seasonal ones include four in Greece,Yerevan in Armenia,Dublin in Ireland,and Ljubljana in Slovenia. Some new destinations that started in 2013 included Yekaterinburg,Russia, Oslo,Norway and Helsinki,Finland. It also does holiday charters across Europe. The fleet in April 2014 included five ATR 72-500's,two Boeing 757-300's,an Embraer 190LR and a 195LR. They had four A321neo's on order and two 787-9's on order and another Embraer 195LR on order. Past planes include some 737-200 Adv.'s and normal 200's, some 757-200's,thirteen Dash 7's,DC-3's,Curtiss Commando's,Handley Page Dart Herald's and Vickers Viscounts. They also in the beginning did helicopter service, the first airline in Israel to do so.
